fieldDescription:
The abyss is a new area focused on [Exploration]. It adds a variety of new loot to find.

For the [Beta], the player starts with the [Singularity Jump] ability, which allows entry in to the abyss from the start of the game.

Only generates on [a new save] and toggling the option has no effect on existing ones.
Changes the difficulty curve of the abyss and changes the strength of encounters. Changes only apply to newly spawned fleets.
Removes the queue system in Colony Construction, allowing everything to be built at the same time.
If set to true and parallel construction is enabled, it will apply the same effect to NPC markets.
Disables help popups in a save even if they were enabled during save creation. Only refreshes on save reloads or newly created saves, [does not re-enable] help-popups if disabled.

defaultValue:
Changes to how starsectors procedual generation works. 
This section is basicly a simplified and more idiot-proof version of Adjusted Sector.
[If Adjusted Sector is installed], this Section is completly [ignored] and Adjusted Sectors configs are used instead.

fieldDescription:
Changes the amount of generated Systems. 
An increase in generated systems come with a [heavy performance cost].

Vanilla Themes will scale with the amount of systems, Modded Themes may not.
Lets you modify how many hyperspace clouds spawn. Vanilla uses a value of 0.8. A lower value will spawn less of them, with a value of 0 spawning none.

Improves the "Miscellaneous" Theme. Starsector generates this theme as a filler for whatever system didnt receive anything special during procgen. In Vannila, those systems rarely give anything of worth, often spawning completely empty systems. Toggling this will prevent those from ever being empty, and gives them a lot more loot.

Multiplies the amount of Hullmod Blueprints being dropped from Salvaging. Useful for when you are playing with lots of mods which add their own hullmods.

Can be changed mid-save.

Multiplies the amount of Ship Blueprints being dropped from Salvaging. Useful for when you are playing with lots of mods which add ships to the same loot-pool. Due to ship blueprints selling for a high price, this option can become quite overpowered if set to high.

Can be changed mid-save.

Replaces the [Campaign Radar] with an interactable minimap that shows information for the current location. Requires a [save-reload] to be enabled/disabled.

The view centers on the fleets location and can not be manualy moved, unless the game is currently paused.

[Warning]: This is relatively performance expensive, especialy so in hyperspace if the amount of generated systems has been increased.

Sets the form-factor of the minimap.
"Wide" takes up more space, but should be easier to interact with, where as "Square" will take up around the same space as the Radar.
Displays the minimap in "Starscape" mode when in Hyperspace. Looks nicer, but can not display sensor activity, slipstreams or hyperspace clouds.
Shows the fuel range overlay on the minimap in hyperspace.

[Legacy Content]. As i am not super happy with the results and the project has been creatively draining, its unlikely that it will receive further updates, but as i know some enjoy the feature, it will remain in the mod for now under this category.

Adds [Modular Superweapons]. With them you can select multiple effects of your choice on to a variety of presets. Those weapons tend to be much stronger than average by design.

Toggling this config only has an effect for [new games]. Enabling it will give the player an ability called "Weapon Forge" at the beginning of the game.
Removes crafting costs for Modular Weapons and displays all modifiers even if they are not unlocked yet.
